benchmark_details.name: GraCoRe (Graph Comprehension and Reasoning)
benchmark_details.overview: GraCoRe is a benchmark for systematically assessing LLMs' graph comprehension and reasoning, including a three-tier hierarchical taxonomy to evaluate models across pure and heterogeneous graphs with 19 tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the understanding and reasoning capabilities of mainstream large language models on graph-structured data.

data.source: Custom generated datasets for pure and heterogeneous graphs and converted real-world datasets (ACM, IMDB).
data.annotation: Manually created based on unique prompts and rules.

methodology.calculation: Standardized scores using z-scores based on performance across tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Standardized scores facilitate fair comparisons across tasks, considering performance variances.
methodology.validation: Evaluated various LLMs to establish performance metrics.
